column1: In the fixed code, the vulnerability has been addressed by adding additional checks for null values. Specifically, after each call to the url_decode_mem and url_decode functions, the returned value is checked and if it is null, the function returns 0. This will ensure that any malicious input is rejected and no further operations may be performed.",640,-77.97555320336039,-0.12183680188025062

column1: The code was fixed by adding input validation checks using spn_c. This function checks whether the characters in a string match a set of accepted characters, returning the number of matched characters. If the number of characters is not equal to the length of the string, then the input must be invalid, and the function returns -1. This fixes the CWE-20 vulnerability by ensuring that only valid input is accepted.",734,-111.87929610507304,-0.1524241091349769
